channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Federal special education staff may get their jobs back. But for how long?
item.description: A new deal to end the government shutdown may briefly restore staff to U.S. Education Department offices that had been gutted by layoffs.

item.title: Oklahoma Governor Commutes Inmate’s Death Sentence Just Before Execution
item.description: The death-row inmate, Tremane Wood, 46, had already had his last meal. It was only the second time Gov. Kevin Stitt has stepped in to stop an executio...

item.title: 'Thrilled to be open': Smithsonian and other museums welcome visitors back
item.description: The Smithsonians, National Gallery of Art and other sites that receive federal funding are announcing their reopening plans now that the government sh...

item.title: Blue Origin Lands Booster After Rocket Launch and Matches SpaceX’s Feat
item.description: The lower half of the New Glenn rocket set down on a platform in the Atlantic Ocean after lifting a small NASA Mars mission to space.

item.title: Family of Fisherman Killed in U.S. Military Strike Says It Wants Justice
item.description: Colombia was a top U.S. ally in Latin America until the Trump administration began deadly strikes in international waters. Now, one family wants justi...

item.title: 'We were gone far too long.' House members reflect on longest shutdown
item.description: The House of Representatives was sent home for the duration of the government shutdown. Members returned to the Capitol Wednesday with a lot on their ...

item.title: Air traffic controllers promised fast shutdown pay, but they've been told that before
item.description: The Transportation Secretary says air traffic controllers will be paid promptly as the government reopens. But after the last shutdown, in 2019, some ...

item.title: Southern California Is Forecast to Get Heavy Rain
item.description: Parts of Los Angeles County will be under evacuation warnings starting Thursday evening as a complex storm system moves in.

item.title: A decade after the Bataclan attacks, France is still grappling with how to remember
item.description: In the 2015 attacks, 130 people were killed, including at the Bataclan concert hall. France is still wrestling with how to remember the deadliest atta...

item.title: BBC Apologizes to Trump Over Film Edit but Declines to Pay Compensation
item.description: The BBC said it would not rebroadcast a misleadingly edited documentary but added, “We strongly disagree there is a basis for a defamation claim.”

item.title: Of Books and Men
item.description: My colleague, the book critic Dwight Garner, tells us about “Flesh” by David Szalay, this year’s Booker Prize winner.

item.title: How France Remembers the November 2015 Terrorist Attacks in Paris

item.title: An Alternative to Christian Nationalism
item.description: Once you put people into categorical boxes, you are inviting them to see history as a zero-sum conflict between this group and that one.
